channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Freedom Mobile Data Breach Exposes Customer PII via Compromised Subcontractor
item.description:
Canadian telecommunications provider Freedom Mobile announced on December 3, 2025, that it suffered a data breach after an unauthorized party gained access to its systems on October 23, 2025. The attacker leveraged the compromised account of a third-party subcontractor to access a customer account m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: ValleyRAT Malware Targets Job Seekers Using Foxit PDF Reader Disguise
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by preying on job seekers. Attackers send emails with weaponized executables disguised as HR documents, using the Foxit PDF Reader icon as a lure. The attack leverages a legitimate, renamed Foxit executable to perform a DLL si...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus APT's Remote IT Worker Infiltration Scheme Exposed in Real-Time
item.description:
A joint investigation by security researchers has exposed the inner workings of a North Korean Lazarus Group scheme where operatives commit identity fraud to get hired as remote IT workers at Western firms. By luring the threat actors into a sophisticated honeypot environment, researchers from BCA L...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Security Operations

item.title: French Football Federation Data Breach Exposes Player Info Via Single Compromised Account
item.description:
The French Football Federation (FFF) announced a significant data breach on November 28, 2025, after an attacker gained access to a centralized administrative software platform using a single compromised user account. The breach exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of a large number...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Phishing

item.title: IT Professional Jailed for 7 Years in Australia for 'Evil Twin' Wi-Fi Attacks on Flights
item.description:
An Australian IT professional, Michael Clapsis, has been sentenced to seven years and four months in prison for conducting sophisticated 'evil twin' Wi-Fi attacks. Using a Wi-Fi Pineapple device, he created rogue Wi-Fi hotspots at airports and on flights to trick travelers into entering their creden...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'HashJack' Attack Injects Malicious Prompts into AI Browsers
item.description:
On November 26, 2025, researchers disclosed a novel indirect prompt injection attack called 'HashJack' that targets AI-enabled web browsers. The technique works by embedding malicious instructions in the fragment portion of a URL (the text following a '#' symbol). Because URL fragments are processed...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Malware, Phishing

item.title: Harvard University Data Breach Exposes Donor Information After Phone Phishing Attack
item.description:
Harvard University has disclosed a data breach affecting its Alumni Affairs and Development Office, discovered on November 18, 2025. The incident originated from a phone-based phishing (vishing) attack that gave an unauthorized party access to systems containing personal information and donation rec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Chicago's St. Anthony Hospital Discloses Data Breach Affecting Over 6,600
item.description:
St. Anthony Hospital in Chicago has reported a data breach that may have exposed the personal and medical information of more than 6,600 patients and staff members. The incident, which was discovered in February 2025, occurred when an unauthorized party gained access to several employee email accoun...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Supply Chain Attacks & AI-Powered Phishing Surge Across Asia-Pacific, Darktrace Warns
item.description:
A new threat report from cybersecurity firm Darktrace highlights a dramatic increase in sophisticated cyber threats across the Asia-Pacific and Japan (APJ) region. The report, covering the 12 months to July 2025, details a surge in supply chain attacks, business email compromise, and cloud intrusion...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: Vendor Breach Exposes Patient Data at Innovative Physical Therapy
item.description:
Innovative Physical Therapy has notified patients of a data breach that originated from a third-party vendor responsible for practice management. The breach occurred when two vendor employees fell victim to phishing emails, leading to the compromise of their email accounts. Between June 25 and June ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing
